definition: hegemon/tyrant/lord/feudal chief/to rule by force/to usurp/(in modern advertising) master

sentences.english: Experts offer their tips on handling bully and toxic bosses.
sentences.chinese: 專家提供了建議，該如何對付這些惡霸式的毒老闆。

sentences.english: They did away with more than 20 local despots that year.
sentences.chinese: 那一年他們剷除了20多個惡霸。

sentences.english: The CIA acts like bullys and expects nobody to fight back?
sentences.chinese: 中情局的行爲就像惡霸而且無人能夠制止？

sentences.english: Manipulator bosses are the smoothest of bullies.
sentences.chinese: 控制者是惡霸中最圓滑的。

sentences.english: The bully said he was going to duke out anyone who disagreed.
sentences.chinese: 那惡霸說他要痛打任何不同意的人。

sentences.english: Mice bullies more angry, and immediately jump also chasing little white cat.
sentences.chinese: 老鼠惡霸更加惱怒，立刻也跳下去追逐小白貓。

sentences.english: There are many types of bully bosses.
sentences.chinese: 有許多類型的惡霸老闆。

sentences.english: After killing the local tyrant Zhen Guanxi， for fear of being jailed， Lu Zhishen fled to Mount Wutai where he stayed in a temple as a monk.
sentences.chinese: 魯智深打死惡霸鎮關西后，怕喫官司，逃往他低。

sentences.english: Cyberbullying is the most devastating bullying in the history of the world.
sentences.chinese: 網絡惡霸是在世界歷史上最具破壞性的惡霸。

sentences.english: Cyberbullying is the most devastating bullying in the history of the world.
sentences.chinese: 網絡惡霸是在世界歷史上最具破壞性的惡霸。

sentences.english: Beginning a little scared mouse bullies inside out to hide the hole dare.
sentences.chinese: 開端，老鼠惡霸還有點害怕，躲進洞裏面不敢出來了。

sentences.english: These benthic bullies need little provocation.
sentences.chinese: 這些水底惡霸很容易被激怒。

sentences.english: Other media outlets catering to young people have also adopted anti-bullying stances.
sentences.chinese: 其他面向青少年的媒體也採取的反惡霸的態勢。

sentences.english: The despot and traitor was brought to public trial during the land reform and all his crimes were exposed.
sentences.chinese: 土改時公審了那個惡霸兼漢奸，並揭露了其全部罪行。

sentences.english: When a bully teased me, he came to my rescue right away.
sentences.chinese: 當惡霸欺負我的時候，他立馬來解救我。

definition: to incite trouble/to stir up havoc
to parade sb through the streets/to march or parade in the streets
to drag sb before a public meeting to denounce, humiliate and physically abuse them (esp. during the Cultural Revolution)
not to shrink from any crime (idiom); to commit any imaginable misdeed
to fight openly and maneuver covertly (idiom)
